intro: Crotalaria obcordata, commonly known as the heartleaf crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow or orange flowers. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. It has a short, upright stem with hairy foliage and produces small, bean-like pods that contain several seeds. Crotalaria obcordata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and unique leaf shape.
